tasks.description_short: Bad things do happen; how I respond to them defines my character and the quality of my life. I can choose to sit in perpetual sadness, immobilized by the gravity of my loss, or I can choose to rise from the pain and treasure the most precious gift I have - life itself.
tasks.author: Walter Anderson

tasks.name: The moment you accept
tasks.description_short: The moment you accept yourself you become beautiful.
tasks.author: Osho

tasks.name: When life is sweet,
tasks.description_short: When life is sweet, and that little voice says: It can't last! Tell yourself: Maybe it's about to get better!
tasks.author: Andrew Matthews

tasks.name: We cannot choose our external circumstances,
tasks.description_short: We cannot choose our external circumstances, but we can always choose how we respond to them.
tasks.description_html: Things themselves don't hurt or hinder us. Nor do other people. How we view these things is another matter. It is our attitudes and reactions that give us trouble.
tasks.author: Sharon Labell

tasks.name: The trick is to be grateful for our good
tasks.description_short: The trick is to be grateful for our good moods and graceful in our low moods - not taking them too seriously. The next time you feel low, for whatever reason, remind yourself 'This too shall pass'. It will.
tasks.description_html: When you're in an ill mood, learn to pass it off as simply that: an unavoidable human condition that will pass with time, if you leave it alone. A low mood is not the time to analyze your life. To do so is emotional suicide. If you have a legitimate problem, it will still be there when your state of mind improves. The trick is to be grateful for our good moods and graceful in our low moods - not taking them too seriously.
tasks.author: Richard Carlson

tasks.name: You have all that it takes to
tasks.description_short: You have all that it takes to go for what you want and to ride the ups and downs that life inevitably brings. No one has a smooth trip but just think how you will feel if you don't even give yourself a chance to get out there and give things a try!
tasks.author: Lynda Field

tasks.name: Every piece of the universe, eve
tasks.description_short: Every piece of the universe, even the tiniest little snow crystal, matters somehow. I have a place in the pattern, and so do you.
tasks.author: T.A. Barron

tasks.name: Life is an echo.
tasks.description_short: Life is an echo. What you send out comes back. What you sow you reap. What you give you get. What you see in others exists in you.
tasks.description_html:
Regardless of who you are or what you do, if you are looking for the best way to reap the most reward in all areas of life, you should look for the good in every person and in every situation and adopt the golden rule as a way of life. 

It's a universal truth that you treat people exactly like you see them. It's also true that all you have to do to find "good" or "ability" in a person is to look for it. Once you find that "good" or "ability" in the other person, you treat him better and he performs better. So it's good "business" and good "humanness" to be a "good finder."
tasks.author: Zig Ziglar

tasks.name: Gratitude unlocks the fullness
tasks.description_short: Gratitude unlocks the fullness of life. It turns what we have into enough, and more. It turns denial into acceptance, chaos to order, confusion to clarity.
tasks.description_html: It can turn a meal into a feast, a house into a home, a stranger into a friend. Gratitude makes sense of our past, brings peace for today and creates a vision for tomorrow.
tasks.author: Melody Beattie

tasks.name: Your present circumstances
tasks.description_short: Your present circumstances don’t determine where you can go; they merely determine where you start.
tasks.author: Nido Qubein

tasks.name: I only have so many days
tasks.description_short: I only have so many days left on earth. I don’t know how many that is, but I do know it’s a very limited number. I know that each one of those limited days is a gift, a blessing, a miracle.
tasks.description_html: For more quotes like this get our app Zen Habits
tasks.author: Leo Babauta

tasks.name: Small things matter.
tasks.description_short: Small things matter. What may look like a small act of courage is courage nevertheless. The important thing is to be willing to take a step forward.
tasks.author: Daisaku Ikeda

tasks.name: Walk with the dreamers
tasks.description_short: Walk with the dreamers, the believers, the courageous, the cheerful, the planners, the doers, the successful people with their heads in the clouds and their feet on the ground. Let their spirit ignite a fire within you to leave this world better than when you found it.
tasks.author: Wilfred Peterson

tasks.name: Do the things
tasks.description_short: Do the things you used to talk about doing but never did!
tasks.description_html:
Know when to let go and when to hold on tight. Stop rushing.

Don't be intimidated to say it like it is.

Stop apologizing all the time. Learn to say no, so your yes has some oomph.

Spend time with the friends who lift you up, and cut loose the ones who bring you down. Stop giving your power away.

Be more concerned with being interested than being interesting.

Be old enough to appreciate your freedom, and young enough to enjoy it. Finally know who you are.
tasks.author: Kristin Armstrong

tasks.name: There are no secrets to success.
tasks.description_short: There are no secrets to success. It is the result of preparation, hard work, and learning from failure.
tasks.author: Colin Powell

tasks.name: There are times in life when
tasks.description_short: There are times in life when, instead of complaining, you do something about your complaints.
tasks.author: Rita Dove

tasks.name: You've been provided with a perfect body
tasks.description_short: You've been provided with a perfect body to house your soul for a few brief moments in eternity. So regardless of its size, shape, color, or any imagined infirmities, you can honor the temple that houses you by eating healthfully, exercising, listening to your body's needs, and treating it with dignity and love.
tasks.author: Wayne Dyer

tasks.name: Never give up on a dream
tasks.description_short: Never give up on a dream just because of the time it will take to accomplish it. The time will pass anyway.
tasks.author: Earl Nightingale

tasks.name: On the road of life, meet people where they are. Accept who they are.
tasks.description_short: On the road of life, meet people where they are. Accept who they are. And there are some folks you need to leave where they are. Keep walking.
tasks.author: Denise Linn

tasks.name: The right time is any time that one is still lucky to have.
tasks.description_short: The right time is any time that one is still lucky to have.
tasks.author: Henry James

tasks.name: Be happy for this moment.
tasks.description_short: Be happy for this moment. This moment is your life.
tasks.author: Omar Khayyam

tasks.name: Anytime you’re filled with resentment,
tasks.description_short: Anytime you’re filled with resentment, you’re turning the controls of your emotional life over to others to manipulate. Send love in some form to those you feel have wronged you and notice how much better you feel.
tasks.description_html:
You hear people say this all the time: “I have a right to be upset because of the way I’ve been treated. I have a right to be angry, hurt, depressed, sad, and resentful.” Learning to avoid this kind of thinking is one of my secrets for living a life of inner peace, success, and happiness. Anytime you’re filled with resentment, you’re turning the controls of your emotional life over to others to manipulate.

You practice forgiveness for two reasons: to let others know that you no longer wish to be in a state of hostility with them and to free yourself from the self-defeating energy of resentment. 

Check out Dr. Wayne W. Dyer
tasks.author: Wayne Dyer

tasks.name: Start where you are. Use what you have. Do what you can.
tasks.description_short: Start where you are. Use what you have. Do what you can.
tasks.author: Arthur Ashe

tasks.name: Promise yourself to
tasks.description_short: Promise yourself to be so strong that nothing can disturb your peace of mind.
tasks.author: Christian D. Larson

tasks.name: Promise yourself to look
tasks.description_short: Promise yourself to look at the sunny side of everything and make your optimism come true.
tasks.author: Christian D. Larson

tasks.name: I've got nothing to do today but smile!
tasks.description_short: I've got nothing to do today but smile!
tasks.author: Paul Simon

tasks.name: Embrace struggle...
tasks.description_short: Embrace struggle... It is your greatest teacher.
tasks.author: Russell Simmons

tasks.name: May I see the things in front
tasks.description_short: May I see the things in front of me as they are, not as I think them to be. May I do what I need to do, not be distracted by what I can’t.
tasks.author: Ian Thomas

tasks.name: And when you appear
tasks.description_short: And when you appear all the rivers sound in my body, bells shake the sky, and a hymn fills the world...
tasks.author: Pablo Neruda

tasks.name: There’s about to be a shift in your life.
tasks.description_short: There’s about to be a shift in your life. Get ready for your blessings. You’ve been through enough and a breakthrough is on the way.
tasks.author: Tony Gaskins

about:
About the App

Life is Beautiful helps you stay inspired - every single day!

Hi, there!

APP UPDATE - Use different fonts and filters to create posters.

Tap on the big round button to show the poster menu:

 

Use Surprise me button to have the app choose one of your photos:

 

Choose fonts and color filters for the poster. Upgrade the app to keep using this feature:

 

Move the text. Tap on it to change style. Pinch it to change the size:

 

Print your posters on mugs, magnets, pendants and more! Just tap on SHARE and select ORDER PRODUCTS & PRINTS.

 

Free version lets you can try the app before you buy it. Upgrade to get the full version. New posters are added daily.

And, try Surprise Me! feature on MY POSTERS screen. It's a lot of fun!

Allow the app to access your photos and associated location info, when asked, so that the app can use your photos for creating posters. For iOS 6, this can also be done in iOS Settings / Privacy / Photos and switch ON Life is Beautiful. For iOS 5, go to Settings / Location Services and switch ON Life is Beautiful.

If you like the app, upgrade it. Not only will you get the full version of the app, but upgrades also let us find more inspiring content for the app. The app is free so that you can try the app before deciding to buy it. And please, spread the word by reviewing the app in the app store (Rate & Review is on the Info screen).

Check out our website:
http://lifeisbeautifulapp.com

Follow us on Twitter and Pinterest:

Have fun!
Ivona & Matjaz

 

Created by Humane Technologies. Check out our other apps in Info screen/tab. This text (About the App) is also available there. The app is using MKStoreKit by Mugunth Kumar for in-app purchases.
